message: The Dems believed in May that they could win the House if they could win six or seven seats in CA by winning the following congressional districts (CA10, CA21, CA25, CA39, CA45, CA48, and CA49). That would turn the CA congressional delegation from 53-14 Dem to 60-7 Dem. It was not happening before the Kavanaugh hearing. Berkeley/IGS dropped polls last week on CDs 10, 21, 25, 39, 45, 48, and 49; but the sampling was done from 9/16-9/23 or before the Kavanaugh fiasco. All the polls on RCP in these potential swing districts polls were sampled in September and also prior to the Kavanaugh confirmation hearings. Here are the September results. CD10 pre-Kavanaugh has Dem up +5; CD21 pre-Kavanaugh has the Rep+11; CD22 pre-Kavanaugh has two polls that average R+11; CD25 has two polls (B/IGS D+4 and NYT R+2) that have the Dems+1; CD39 has two polls that average R+4.5; CD45 has two polls that average D+6; CD48 has two polls that show a tie; CD49 has two polls that average D+12; CD50 has two polls that have the Rep+8.5. Based on polls pre-Kavanaugh, CA21 and CA39 are likely to go Rep. CD25 and CD48 are tied. CD10 (D+5) and CD45 (D+6) should swing Rep if any polling is done in the next week or post Kavanaugh. That would turn the CA congressional delegation from 53-14 Dem to 60-7 Dem. It was not happening before the Kavanaugh hearing. Berkeley/IGS dropped polls last week on CDs 10, 21, 25, 39, 45, 48, and 49; but the sampling was done from 9/16-9/23 or before the Kavanaugh fiasco. All the polls on RCP in these potential swing districts polls were sampled in September and also prior to the Kavanaugh confirmation hearings. Here are the September results. CD10 pre-Kavanaugh has Dem up +5; CD21 pre-Kavanaugh has the Rep+11; CD22 pre-Kavanaugh has two polls that average R+11; CD25 has two polls (B/IGS D+4 and NYT R+2) that have the Dems+1; CD39 has two polls that average R+4.5; CD45 has two polls that average D+6; CD48 has two polls that show a tie; CD49 has two polls that average D+12; CD50 has two polls that have the Rep+8.5. Based on polls pre-Kavanaugh, CA21 and CA39 are likely to go Rep. CD25 and CD48 are tied. CD10 (D+5) and CD45 (D+6) should swing Rep if any polling is done in the next week or post Kavanaugh. Only CD49 looks like a Dem win in the 7 seats the Dems targeted last May before the CA primaries in June. RCP calls five of them toss-ups (CA10, CA25, CA39, CA45, and CA48). Post-Kavanaugh polling should show a weakening in the Dems vote in those five. Without CA, there is no blue wave.
